column2: "How is it, Zieg? Do you see anything wrong?"
"Erm... I see no obvious malfunction. The restoration was perfect."
"But... it's not the same. Using it in battle, it doesn't feel the same."
"...I know what yer tryin' to say. Clarissa's boundless power is gone."
"After reassemblin' her, I sensed a dormant power. Now? ...gone."
"I dunno the exact way to say it, but one thing's for sure - she's weaker than before."
"Aww... I wonder why?"
"If I had to venture to guess... it's because Xion is no more."
"The Genesis Weapons owed their extraordinary performance to the power they received from the Mothership."
"Now that the Mothership's... I mean, Xion's... power is gone, they are now a shadow of what they used to be."
"...hmph, you got that right. Even 'ol Zieg here could craft one o' this level."
"The World Ender couldn't even hold up after one use without the Mothership's power."
"It goes to show just how vital her power was to the Genesis Weapons."
"But even among the Genesis Weapons, Clarissa is an exception. Her origin is different."
"It's a miracle alone that it still maintains its form. I doubt its power will ever be the same."
"...So, Clarissa is kind of a momento of Xion, then?"
"...You could say so."
"...Regius. The fact that yer here means you've got it settled, then?"
"Right you are, Zieg. Xiao gave it the green light. Can we count on you for a new line of Genesis Weapons?"
"Hmph... easier said than done! But as a craftsman there's no way I'm backin' down!"
"Oh yes! Missie, do you mind if I have another go at refurbishin' Clarissa?"
"She'll never be like the 'ol days, but if I take 'er apart and put 'er back together, we might come pretty darn close!"
"...Thanks, Zieg, but... I like Clarissa the way she is. We're a team."
